The GDP response to a one standard deviation weather shock is approximately -0.6%.
The CPI response to a one standard deviation weather shock is approximately -0.1%.
The interest rate response to a one standard deviation weather shock is approximately -0.1%.
The credit response to a one standard deviation weather shock is approximately -0.4%.

Stacked bar chart shows a negative impact on GDP due to weather shock around 2020; Units are unclear (possibly % deviation from trend). The stacked bar also includes impacts from CPI, rate, and credit shocks.

The counterfactual scenario considers a one standard deviation weather shock. The -0.6 percent represents the response of output to this shock after approximately 20 quarters (5 years) when monetary policy does not react, thus approximately evaluated in 2025 if the shock happened in 2020.
